ai.summary: Leasowes & Coombeswood Countryside Walk is a 7.4 km moderate loop through UK countryside. The route blends grassy field paths, hedgerows and short woodland stretches with gentle elevation changes, offering varied rural scenery and several gates or stiles along the way.
ai.terrain_summary: Mixed surfaces including compact country lanes, grassy tracks, and occasional muddy sections after rain. Expect short woodland segments, uneven footing, and gates or stiles requiring hands-on passage. Some parts may be slippery when wet and exposed winds on open sections.
ai.safety_notes: Check the weather forecast and wear sturdy, grippy footwear. Stay on marked paths and heed signage. Be prepared for mud, uneven ground, and gates or stiles. Carry water and a snack, and allow extra time. Mobile signal can be patchy in rural areas; inform someone of your plan and ETA. Be mindful of livestock and weather-related hazards; carry a basic first aid kit and a whistle for emergencies.
recommended_gear: Sturdy walking boots with good grip
Weather-appropriate clothing and a waterproof layer
Map or GPS device and a charged phone
Light headlamp or flashlight (for late finishes)
ai.best_seasons: Spring to autumn are usually best for this walk; it can be tackled year-round with appropriate clothing and footwear, though winter conditions may make surfaces wetter and more challenging.

seo.title: Leasowes & Coombeswood Countryside Walk – 7.4 km Moderate Hike in the UK
seo.meta_description: Explore the Leasowes & Coombeswood Countryside Walk, a 7.4 km moderate hike through UK countryside featuring fields, hedgerows and woodlands. Practical safety tips and gear included.
